definitions.definition: To constrain someone by force or by social , moral or legal means.
examples: I am obliged to report to the police station every week.

definitions.definition: To do (someone) a service or favour (hence, originally, creating an obligation).
examples: He obliged me by not parking his car in the drive.
The singer obliged with another song.
I am obliged to you for your recent help.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To constrain someone by force or by social , moral or legal means.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , intransitive ) To do (someone) a service or favour (hence, originally, creating an obligation).
( intransitive ) To be indebted to someone.
